ratings.question_text: Overall, how would you rate the workload of this course in comparison to other Yale courses you have taken:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?
The primary instructor's sensitivity to students and ability to provide students with adequate feedback was:

narratives.question_text: Indicate the total number of hours per week (outside the classroom) you spent on this course:
comments: 5-6 hours per homework, 3 homework assignments total
4 hours

about 10 hours/week. Additional reading is unnecessary since the course notes are so comprehensive, but the homework assignments do require a LOT of time. However, completing the homework assignments and calculations solidified my knowledge and learning of concepts, so I'm not sure what to recommend.
At least 8 hours a week.
12 hours a week.
4h

I spent about 5-10 hours per week in this class. It was a lot of work and comprised the majority of my workload this semester, along with Design of Epi, the other half credit course. There was homework assigned every week and a half.
I have no idea, but this course took way more time than any of my other courses... by far.
10-12hours per week, esp if homework was due
I spent at least 12 hours/week outside the class room.
more than 10 hours a week
10 hours per week
8 hours/week

narratives.question_text: Looking back on this course, what is your overall assessment of the course:  What are its strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might it be improved?
comments: It is quite intensive course with a lot of materials needed to cover. Sometimes the equations and theories make the class not very intriguing.

The powerpoint slides created by the professor are incredible. I think this class could have had a little more focus on the SAS, but the professor did do a good job of balancing theory and application.
More time spent using SAS, less time doing calculus.Final survival analysis project in SAS is more useful and practical than an in-class exam.
This course is a very introductory course to survival analysis. Well structured.
A comprehensive, well-taught course on the essentials of theory and the details on practical applications of survival analysis
Wonderful introduction to survival analysis. A lot of information in a very short amount of time, making the final exam one of the most difficult I've taken recently.

This course offered an in-depth view of survival analysis that epi students rarely get in other courses. It was extremely useful solving problems by hand before moving into SAS coding.My only suggestion would be for this portion of the course to be longer.

Maria is wonderful. She is a excellent and dedicated teacher. All teachers should be like her! The work was alot, but there was not a lot of time to teach all the material. I think this course should be a semester long.
useful
I liked this course because there was a lot of useful coding information as well as theoretical information about survival analysis. That class itself was structured well. I enjoyed the class.
It's helpful but a lot of work

strengths: maria is a very good instructor with helpful slidesareas for improvement: would provide answer keys at least for the homework assignments. Would also consider using a little more computer-based computation of the homework assignments. There was not enough time alotted to complete the final exam, perhaps would have been better as a take home. Wonder if the class would be better if allowed to take up an entire semester! There is quite a bit to learn!
The course material was very useful and supplemented my other coursework very well.

I think that students with diverse backgrounds in the same class, for example biostatistics PhDs and physicians make it challenging to fit a course that would not be too easy or too difficult for some students. In opinion this course was better fitted for biostatisticians than for physicians like without any calculus background. For me a less mathematical and more practical approach would be better.I also think it is too much information for a half semester, my suggestion would be making this course a full semester and include labs. It is a very important topic, the teacher is excellent, but unfortunately I could not learn as much as I would like to.

Stength - Notes were incredibly resourceful and could be used without needing a textbookWeakness - Too much material for such a short course; little time for thorough examples (e.g. model building); updates to the slides were made often without students being informed - it would have been helpful to know which slides were added or changed so only those had to be printed/reprinted; having a homework assignment due during reading week took a significant amount of time away from my studying for other classes
wonderful and excellent
It was very well organized and consistent between the lectures and homeworks
Strength: well-summarized lectures and powerpoint slidesWeakness: inconsistent grading of the assignments.
The class materials are wonderful and the instructions of the professor are very clear and easy to follow. And this class has greatly helped me gain an extensive knowledge of survival analysis.

Maria is an excellent instructor who did a great job tackling a tough topic (survival analysis). Notes are excellent and examples are clear. This course requires one to re-learn calculus in order to derive/integrate survival and hazard functions. Given the amount of material covered, this should be a semester long course rather than a half semester. Because it was the second half of the semester, with reading week, etc -- there were only 5 lectures for the course, and it was densely packed with info. Tough but worthy course.
Homework assignments were great, but often overwhelming. Repetitive. If there was more feedback on the homework assignments and logical grading of the assignments, the course would be much better.

while most students must have had a solid math base, for AP students who are farther away from highschool it was a bit of a challenge.Maybe having a crash course in calculus and excel in the beginning would help, especially since the work load was so heavily based on it!!!I honestly struggled to keep up with the course load, to finish the final exam on time in class, and I am not sure that I will ever again do Kaplan Meyer curves by hand, ever again!For exercise or homework doing them by hand helps with understanding, but as an exam.;...THe parts of the exam that emphasized reading and interpreting SAS output were extremely useful!!So I am only speaking from my AP perspective: I think I will end up using only 10% of the class material - SAS related...and is too bad, because Maria put so much effort into making superb slides and explaining things at length!I am suggesting to bring more "practicality" (from AP students perspective at least): bring articles with survival analysis in them, go through the data and how this was analyzed, intepret more SAS outputs
Excellent

Strengths: comprehensive coverage of material. Weaknesses: theoretical material presented without adequate explanation of how and when to apply it; homework assignments began too late in the course and overloaded us with work during the critical time leading into finals; lecture format was completely non-interactive and hard to follow. This appeared to be a full semester's worth of material, crammed into a half-semester timeframe.

narratives.question_text: Please evaluate the instructor of this course. What are the instructor's strengths and weaknesses, and in what ways might his or her teaching be improved?
comments: Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  She is very nice and her lecture materials are designed with great details.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Dr Ciarleglio is incredible. I think she is the best biostatistics professor I have ever had, not to mention she is so nice and approachable.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Provides thorough and well-organized slides. Always corrects typos/mistakes on slides and uploads updated versions asap. She tends to teach to the projector screen instead of the class, but this does not take away from the overall course experience. She is good at clearly answering questions.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is a very responsible and helpful instructor. Her slides are great! Clear and detailed notes!
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  She is probably the best biostats instructor I have ever had. So well organized, clear examples, well-written notes.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Very good teacher. Might consider the calculus review a little earlier given its use on the homework and final.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Dr. Ciarleglio presented her material so that everyone was capable of following along. She is responsive to emails, personable, and well-prepared. We are lucky to have her at Yale!
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Amazing! Best biostats teacher! Lectures were clear. Her slides had a plethora of information.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  good

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  The professor, Dr. Ciarleglio, was a good instructor. She was very nice and was always very prompt with answering questions during and outside of class. She went through the information smoothly and everything in lecture was very understandable. I do sometimes think that she covered too much in one lecture where she didn't have the opportunity to reinforce or really explain the lecture notes very well. However, I thought that overall, the class was very informative.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  She is very clear and helpful
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria is so sweet, but should try to talk slightly more independently of her otherwise excellent powerpoints!
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Maria was very nice, very responsive, interested in teaching but also clearly interested in the subject matter

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Dr. Ciarleglio was a great teacher, especially given the fact that she was a new teacher. Her notes were thorough and very informative. If there is something to work on, sometimes she read from the slides. Overall, she'll only become a better teacher.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  The instructor is great; she did an awesome job putting an enormous amount of information on her slides. She is very competent and truly sensitive to students; I think the problem was the course format - short time, no labs and too much math.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Very nice, very helpful
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Very approachable and willing to help
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  She was so kind and generous.Lecture was clear and enough to motivate interest in survival analysis.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  This was a very well organized class and she was very helpful responding to questions or answering them after class.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Very nice and willing to help outside class hours.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  She is truly a passionate and inspirational woman who creates a similar drive in her students.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Excellent instructor, very smart and clear in her explanations. Homework assignments are long and the final was tough but she is a very fair (and generous) grader and she just wants us to learn the material.
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Great, very comprehensive notes.

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Unbelievably supportive, warm personality!very clear-headed and extremely knowledgeable, no question no matter how geeky would phase her!I just wish she could engage us more! sometimes you need feedback from the class to see when you lose your audience!Extremely approachable, eager to give feedback and assist, is a phenomenal professor!
Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  Excellent, very clear teaching

Instructor: Maria Michelle Ciarleglio  The instructor clearly cares about the subject matter and her students. She lacks experience in how to convey information effectively, and also tends to over-estimate student capacity for assimilating theoretical information without interaction or reinforcement.

narratives.question_text: If this course included instruction by a teaching assistant (TA), please evaluate the TA here. What are the strengths and weaknesses and how might their teaching be improved? (Specify name of the TA).
comments: Good. With great humor.
Greg was a great TA. He even taught a lecture for us to catch up on calculus. He was really nice, but kind of picky and subjective when it came to grading.
Greg score every homework carefully. He is good.

Greg was open to meeting when I could not come to his office hours. I would suggest scheduling office hours at a better time - after concepts have been covered in class and before a homework is due (I know that was out of your control, but in this half semester, the timing just didn't work out between the dates the assignments were due)
Great review of calculus during one of the classes. Easy to understand.
Greg Ryslik was a great TA. He was a fair grader and did a fantastic job with his calculus review. Much appreciated.
Is there any TA?

The TA was Greg. He was fine as a TA. I thought he was very knowledgeable on the subject matter, but was very quick during office hours and expected a lot from us, especially during the calculus portion of the class. Also, the grading of homework was very subjective, which I did not appreciate at all. When comparing the same answers with classmates, different amounts of points were taken off - most were more than I believed was deserved.
he explains things clear but does not grade homework based on a consistent standard
could have been more available and more patient when working with students.
The TA was very helpful and easy to communicate with. He was also funny.
The TA was good. He was always available, helpful and has a sound knowledge of the course material.
Greg Ryslikinconsistent grading (e.g. different number of points deducted for same error on 2 students' homework assignments)calculus lecture was helpful
Greg was very good at holding office hours and answering emails

Knowledgeable, but very inconsistent grading scheme (example: 1) taking off many points for insignificant details whereas taking off much less points for very important concepts, etc. 2) two students lost different amounts of points for the exact same mistake). Did not feel that I am getting good feedback on assignment 3.
The TA is very supportive and always response promptly.
Greg was OK -- seemed nice initially and was sometimes helpful but also declined to help on one occasion that seemed unfair to me.
Illogical grading. No feedback. Not friendly and not very helpful in teaching the material when help is seeked. Needs to communicate more with the professor and think more about the students.
Excellent
The TA was available to answer questions by email and during office hours, which were very helpful. Feedback on the homework was somewhat lacking, and the points systemwas not clear.

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize this course for a fellow student? Would you recommend it to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Yes.
Yes, I think it is a great course because it really teaches you how to use survival analysis for epi studies.
Nice course. Helpful either in survival analysis and clinical trial!
Definitely recommend - good balance of theory and applied analysis with clear SAS examples
Excellent class to gain a basic understanding of surival analysis, but the homework and final were no joke.

I would highly recommend this course to all epi and biostats students. Survival analysis is frequently referred to in other courses, but it is rarely explained in sufficient detail. This course provides the best overview of the basics of survival analysis that I have had, and then goes on to explain parametric models, non-parametric models, model building, and SAS coding. The calculus was minimal, but very useful.
Yes, I learned a lot, but make sure they time is there to dedicate to the class.
useful

This is a theoretical and practical application of survival analysis. I would recommend this class to biostats and other students interested in performing this kind of analysis in the future. The course notes are very thorough. I will keep the lecture notes even after graduating to reflect back on.
It is very helpful
it's quite a bit ofwork!
I would definitely recommend this course. Very informative and helpful for public health degree.

If the student is a physician with no calculus or advanced math background, and he or she is not very much interested in understand all the details of calculation of a survival analysis, I wouldn't recommend this course unless the student does not have other choices to complete his/her requirements.I would definitively recommend it for a statistician.
Good introduction to survival analysis methods and the SAS code for performing them; a lot of material is introduced in just a few weeks
Highly recommended
It was a very good detailed survival analysis class
good course, will be much better if the course is more interactive.
Good but tough course. Ideally would be a full semester with proper TA/lab sessions. Get ready to relearn calculus!
Very fast-paced and challenging, but learned a lot from it.
if you are a student interested in pursuing a PhD in statistics, this is the way to go!if you are AP student, grin and bear it!
Yes, it is very proud to recommend this course.

This course presents valuable information, but is a bit too theoretical in its emphasis, and would be better taught as a full-semester format. The instructor will improve with more teaching experience.
